result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kameron M Anderson

records.addlTxt: and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Order Binding Over DE for Trial
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $15,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
_x_ Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can arrive at Pretrial Services between the hours of 8 am and 3 pm (Monday through Friday) unless the jail has cleared a later arrival time directly with Pretrial Services. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AMB or any immediate family member of AMB. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with RJR, CKM, or TRR. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any juvenile. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence at all times except only for medical emergencies, scheduled medical appointments, to meet with legal counsel, or to attend scheduled court hearings. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

4:10 PM Defendant Kameron M Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Kathleen Chung in court for Kameron M Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
